abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column calls on Pro Football Hall of Fame to allow former linebacker Junior Seau's daughter Sydney to speak about him at induction ceremony; postulates that Hall of Fame is not forbidding speech as simple matter of policy, but out of fear that she might mention brain disease her father suffered that was likely caused by head traumas sustained in his job.
lead_paragraph: Allowing Seau’s daughter Sydney to bid a proper farewell to her dad before his N.F.L. family is an easy fix if the Pro Football Hall of Fame allows common sense to be its guide.

headline.main: Cloud Hangs Over Hall of Fame Farewell to Junior Seau
headline.print_headline: Challenging the Hall, and Hoping for Compassion

snippet: Allowing Seau’s daughter Sydney to bid a proper farewell to her dad before his N.F.L. family is an easy fix if the Pro Football Hall of Fame allows common sense to be its guide.
